section.para: Accounts are central to the xTuple CRM system. An Account holds information about an entity and serves to define it further as a Customer, Prospect, Vendor, Competitor, or Partner. To create a new Account, select the CRM, Account, New option. The following screen will appear.
When creating a new Account, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: The Account Number uniquely identifies the CRM Account.
Enter the name of the Account you do business with (e.g., Customer Name or Vendor Name). This field should not to be confused with the Contact name of an individual at the company.
Select if you are actively doing business with this Account. Not selecting makes the Account inactive.
Specify one of the following Account Types:
Select if the Account is an organization.
Select if the Account is an individual.
Enter the Account Number of the CRM Account (if any) which serves as the parent for the Account.
Enter a Contact who serves as the Owner of the CRM Account.
Indicate how the Account relates to your business by selecting from the available options. A single CRM Account may have multiple different roles:
Select if the Account is a Prospect. Specific Prospect information is maintained on the Prospect screen, which can be reached by selecting the PROSPECT button.
Select if the Account is a Customer Account. Specific Customer information is maintained on the Customer screen, which can be reached by selecting the CUSTOMER button.
Select if the Account is a Vendor Account. Specific Vendor information is maintained on the Vendor screen, which can be reached by selecting the VENDOR button.
Select if the Account is a Sales Representative. Specific Sales Rep information is maintained on the Sales Rep screen, which can be reached by selecting the SALES REP button.
Select if the Account is an Employee. Specific Employee information is maintained on the Employee screen, which can be reached by selecting the EMPLOYEE button.
Select if the Account is a User. Specific User information is maintained on the User screen, which can be reached by selecting the USER button.
Select if the Account is a Tax Authority. Specific Tax Authority information is maintained on the Tax Authority screen, which can be reached by selecting the TAX AUTHORITY button.
Select if the Account is a Competitor. There is no separate screen for maintaining Competitor information.
Select if the Account is a Partner. There is no separate screen for maintaining Partner information.

section.para: When defining or viewing Contacts for the specified Account, you are presented with the following options:

tip.para: For Contacts, you have two options:

listitem.para: Attach an existing Contact to the Account
Enter new Contact information

Select to enter or view information for the primary Contact. You can manually enter Contact information in the fields shown—or use the lookup feature to select pre-existing Contact information. If a new Contact is manually entered here, that Contact will be added automatically to the master list of Contacts. For additional documentation related to creating Contacts, see .

Select to enter or view information for the secondary Contact. You can manually enter Contact information in the fields shown—or use the lookup feature to select pre-existing Contact information. If a new Contact is manually entered here, that Contact will be added automatically to the master list of Contacts. For additional documentation related to creating Contacts, see .
Select to view the master list of Contacts associated with the Account.

section.para: The following buttons are unique to this screen:

listitem.para: Highlight a Contact and then select this button to remove the association between the Contact and the CRM Account.
Select to associate a new Contact with the CRM Account.

section.para: To enter or associate To-Dos, Opportunities, or Incidents with a CRM Account, select the "Activities" tab. The following screen will appear:
When associating To-Dos, Opportunities, or Incidents with a CRM Account, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Specify which of the following options you want to include in the list:
Select to include To-Dos in the display. If not selected, To-Dos will not be included.
Select to include Opportunities in the display. If not selected, To-Dos will not be included.
Select to include Incidents in the display. If not selected, Incidents will not be included.
Displays To-Dos, Opportunities, and Incidents associated with the Account.

section.para: You have the ability to track Lot/Serial registrations by CRM Account. In most cases, registrations must be manually entered. However, in the case of Items sold to Customers, the system can be configured to automatically track warranty registrations for you.

tip.para: If you select the "Auto Register Lot/Serial at Shipping" option on the Item Site for an Item, then the system will automatically track registrations (by Customer) whenever the Item is shipped. This applies only to sold Items which are Lot/Serial controlled.
